授業目的: The purpose of this course is to provide opportunities for students to apply marketing theories to practices. Students will conduct an in-depth analysis of real-world cases relevant to marketing strategies and consumer behavior.
到達目標:
1.Students will acquire a practical understanding of the complexity of making marketing decisions in various settings.
2.Students will acquire the ability to categorize and synthesis various marketing issues or problems of each case into relevant components for in-depth analysis.
3.Students will develop the ability to judge the value and relevance of information in each case to provide workable strategic options.
授業方法: Intensive class discussion, group work and presentation.

トピック.授業外学習2:
This course is for the students who have completed the Marketing Management course or have a basic understanding of marketing before taking this course.
Students must read each case before class discussion and draw attention to the issues of the case. There are no right or wrong opinions or answers when discussing each case. The only thing is that some are better than others; these depend on students' understanding of each case and the ability to relate the case's issues to learned marketing theories and practices.
